Purdue University
LAFAYETTE, INDIANA
August 23, 1962
TELEVISION UNIT
Mr. William G. Harley
President, NAEB
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington 6, D.C.
Dear Bill;
I HAVE AT HAND JOHNNY ScHWARZWALDER1S
LATEST DIATRIBE. IrM AFRAID l AM NO MORE
IMPRESSED BY IT THAN I WAS BY PREVIOUS ONES.
I THINK THE ACTION TAKEN AT THE MEETING IN
Washington were in line and trust we are
PROCEEDING ALONG THOSE LINES.
I AM CURRENTLY READING "THE RISE AND FALL
of the Third Reich". Compared to the
MACHINATIONS OF THE GERMAN POLITICIANS AT
THE TIME THEY CAME TO POWER, THE CURRENT
ones with NAEB, NETRC, and various splinter
GROUPS SEEM MIGHTY MINUTE. HOWEVER, THERE
IS ONE LESSON TO BE LEARNED, AND THAT IS THAT
WE MUST REMAIN TRUE TO OUR BELIEFS IN THE
DEMOCRATIC PROCESSES AND CONTINUE TO ALLOW
PEOPLE TO EXPRESS THEIR OWN OPINION, BUT NOT
BE SWAYED BY THREATS OF WITHDRAWAL OR
OBVIOUS EVIDENCES OF BAD FAITH. CERTAINLY WE
SHOULD NOT EXCHANGE ONE CURRENT DICTATOR FOR
ONE POTENTIAL DICTATOR. I HAVE FAITH THAT
THE WAY WILL BE FOUND TO SETTLE OUR
DIFFERENCES AND MOVE AHEAD RAPIDLY VIA THE
DEMOCRATIC PROCESS.
Sincerely,
/
James S. Miles
Director Radio-TV
